issues.description: Constructor signature mismatch for SealSaloon: The problem statement and UML specify a constructor SealSaloon(String) that takes the saloon name (lines describing the constructor in the problem). However, both the provided template/usage (Main) and the solution implement and call a no-argument constructor SealSaloon() (Main in template and solution instantiate with new SealSaloon(); the solution's SealSaloon.java defines a no-arg constructor). This inconsistency will confuse students about which constructor to implement and may cause compilation or test failures depending on which signature they follow.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the constructor requirement consistent across artifacts. Either:
- Update the problem statement to require a no-argument SealSaloon() constructor (and remove/clarify the sentence about taking a saloon name) so it matches the template Main and the solution; OR
- Modify the template Main and the solution SealSaloon to use SealSaloon(String name) (and, if desired, add a private name field with a getter). Ensure all sample usage and the UML/documentation reflect the chosen constructor signature.
